On 22/12/2007, Ken Lloyd <kalloyd@...> wrote:
> Before I possibly re-invent the wheel, I thought I'd ask if anyone has already developed a Design of Experiments interface to NEAT that normalizes the experiment functions into inputs, biases and outputs?  If not, is this something that the group would find useful?

If you're meaning code interfaces then yeh, sharpneat has an
IExperiment interface, see:

http://sharpneat.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/sharpneat/trunk/src/SharpNeatLib/Experiments/IExperiment.cs?revision=6&view=markup

With traditional NEAT there is not really any point in having more
than one bias input so I chose to fix it to node 0, hence that is
assumed to always be present and isn't defined by IExperiment.

Colin.
